snippet: A coalition of 26 states has sued over the president’s efforts to provide work permits for millions of illegal immigrants, accusing him of abuse of power.
abstract: Supreme Court agrees to hear challenge to Pres Obama's overhaul of America's immigration laws, in case that will determine whether Obama's use of executive action in protecting immigrants constitutes overreach; justices, in unusual move, raise question of whether Obama violated constitutional obligations to enforce United States law; outcome could influence balance of power between president and Congress.

byline.original: By ADAM LIPTAK and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: A coalition of 26 states has sued over the president’s efforts to provide work permits for millions of illegal immigrants, accusing him of abuse of power.

headline.main: Supreme Court to Hear Challenge to Obama Immigration Actions
headline.print_headline: Justices to Hear State Challenge on Immigration
